result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario A Quiroz

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mario A Quiroz
Current: 107 College St, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 08-25-2022)
Prior: 200 1/2 Lynn St, Watertown, WI 53098

[ma] Cases 21CF241, 21CF498, 22CF118, 22CF150, 22CF361, 22CM73, 22CF151 called at 10:46 AM 
Defendant Mario A Quiroz in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Mario A Quiroz.  
Defendant Debra Marie Uttech appears in court, without counsel. 
Defendant Heather J Uttech appears with zoom. Attorney Cassi Nelson appears via zoom for Heather J Uttech. 
Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court records.

As to Quiroz's cases:
--Atty Huebner requests a pretrial be scheduled in 22CF150 and all cases scheduled for status thereafter

As to Debra Uttech's cases: 
--Debra Uttech qualifies for public defender representation, but no attorney was available for todays proceedings. 

Initial Appearance occurs in Case 22CF361:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel given.
Debra Uttech updates address to: 107 College St. Watertown 53094

The Court requires a $2500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--not to possess any personally identifying information or documents not issued in own name

The Court tolls time limits 

As to Heather Uttech's cases: 
Atty Nelson requests a preliminary hearing be scheduled via zoom

recess: 11:01am 
NEXT: As to 22CF151, Heather Uttech, Preliminary Hearing on 9/20/22 at 8:30am via zoom
As to 22CF150, Quiroz, (1)Pretrial on 9/21/22 at 2:40pm (2) Status on 11/17/22 at 11:00am
As to 21CF241, 21CF498, 22CF118, Quiroz, Status on 11/17/22 at 11:00am
As to 22CF361 & 22CM73, Debra Uttech, Status on 11/17/22 at 11:00am (status of counsel?)
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ma] Cases 21CF241,21CF498,22CF118,22CF150 called at 9:04am 
Defendant Mario A Quiroz in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.   Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occur in Cases 22CF118 & 22CF150:
Mr.Quiroz waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 9:12am  

NEXT:   Status Conference on 8/25/22 at 10:30am
Letter from Att Huebner RE: Billable hours
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ae] cases 21CF241, 21CF498, 22CF118 and 22CF150 called 10:34 AM Defendant Mario A Quiroz in court with attorney Karl E Huebner. ADA MIchaels  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court appoints Atty Huebner to 22CF118 and 22CF150 with same repayment as previously ordered
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited

As to 22CF118 and 22CF150:
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1500 Signature Bond to cover both 22CF118 and 22CF150, with conditions:
--no contact with Michael Miller or Heather Uttech
--not to discuss the case with Debra Uttech 
--no presence at Mercandito La Rosita in the City of Watertown
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--As to case 22CF150 Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs) 



recess 10:43 am
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on  6/1/22 at 9:00 am  (2) Status Conference/Preliminary Hearing on 6/17/22 at 9:00 am
